name: Basic LED Circuit With Power Supply and Resistor
description: A simple safe LED circuit powered by a 5V source using a 220Ω resistor to protect the LED from burning.
connections: LED glows safely because the resistor limits current
howItWorks: The resistor limits current flowing through the LED to prevent damage. When power is applied, current flows through the resistor and LED, causing it to glow steadily.
powerNotes: Use any 5V regulated power supply (Arduino 5V, bench supply, USB output).
safetyNotes: Never connect LED directly to power without resistor.
Ensure correct polarity: long leg is anode (+).
